Name: GE Blonde
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Garnish with apple wedge on rim.
Review: This delicate cocktail is best with freshly pressed apple juice and flavoursome Scotch with subtle peat.
History: This cocktail was a combined effort by the staff of London's GE Club in January 2002. Linda, a waitress at the club who happens to be blonde, named it, although she said the name was inspired by the cocktail's straw colour.
Nutrition: One serving of GE Blonde contains 210 calories
